005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model.util.ModuleUtils;
009
010import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
011
012/**
013 * A base class for an assembly definition defined globally within a Metaschema
014 * module.
015 *
016 * @param <MODULE>
017 *          the Java type of the containing module
018 * @param <INSTANCE>
019 *          the expected Java type of an instance of this definition
020 * @param <FLAG>
021 *          the expected Java type of flag children
022 * @param <MODEL>
023 *          the expected Java type of model children
024 * @param <NAMED_MODEL>
025 *          the expected Java type of named model children
026 * @param <FIELD>
027 *          the expected Java type of field children
028 * @param <ASSEMBLY>
029 *          the expected Java type of assembly children
030 * @param <CHOICE>
031 *          the expected Java type of choice children
032 * @param <CHOICE_GROUP>
033 *          the expected Java type of choice group children
034 */
035public abstract class AbstractGlobalAssemblyDefinition<
036    MODULE extends IModule,
037    INSTANCE extends IAssemblyInstance,
038    FLAG extends IFlagInstance,
039    MODEL extends IModelInstanceAbsolute,
040    NAMED_MODEL extends INamedModelInstanceAbsolute,
041    FIELD extends IFieldInstanceAbsolute,
042    ASSEMBLY extends IAssemblyInstanceAbsolute,
043    CHOICE extends IChoiceInstance,
044    CHOICE_GROUP extends IChoiceGroupInstance>
045    extends AbstractGlobalDefinition<MODULE, INSTANCE>
046    implements IAssemblyDefinition, IFeatureContainerFlag<FLAG>, IFeatureContainerModelAssembly<
047        MODEL,
048        NAMED_MODEL,
049        FIELD,
050        ASSEMBLY,
051        CHOICE,
052        CHOICE_GROUP> {
053
054  /**
055   * Construct a new global assembly definition.
056   *
057   * @param module
058   *          the parent module containing this definition
059   */
060  protected AbstractGlobalAssemblyDefinition(@NonNull MODULE module) {
061    super(module, name -> ModuleUtils.parseModelName(module, name));
062  }
063}
